definition: 48 districts in Eastern and Western Uganda were included, covering a wide range of epidemiological settings with varying levels of malaria transmission and insecticide resistance.

label: Enumeration area ID
definition: The primary sampling units were enumeration areas identified in the 2014 Ugandan national census. Ten enumeration areas were randomly selected in each of the health sub-districts. Within each sampled enumeration area, 5 households were randomly enrolled per study timepoint, for a total of 50 households sampled per cluster per study timepoint.

label: Subdistrict
definition: A kebele, or ward, is the smallest administrative unit of Ethiopia. Consists of >500 families, generally 3,500-4,000 people

label: Taluk
definition: Administrative division with a city or town that serves as its administrative center. Generally encompasses an area of land with a number of villages and possibly some towns.

label: Town or district
definition: Town or woreda, which is the 3rd-level administrative division in Ethiopia. Further subdivided into wards (kebele, here labeled as "Subdistrict").

label: Union council
definition: The smallest rural administrative or local government unit in Bangladesh.
